p: The concentration and composition of A. absinthium essential oil from plants growing in Poland were tested in 2007. In the flowering herb of plants collected from an area in the Mrągowo District (North-East part of Poland), the essential oil content ranged from 0.90% to 1.45%. The concentration of the oil in plants in the vegetative stage was lower and amounted to 0.60–0.94%. The compounds isolated in the largest quantities were: sabinyl acetate, chrysantenyl acetate, β-thujone, and cineol [ 17].
